alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 02 at 5:22AM MST until March 03 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW TO IMPACT MOUNTAIN PASSES... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 14 inches in the mountains, including Lookout Pass. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches in the valleys. Ridgetop winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...St. Maries, Wallace, Fernwood, Mullan, Osburn, Fourth Of July Pass, Pinehurst, Kellogg, Dobson Pass, and Lookout Pass. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Motorists should anticipate winter driving conditions for the morning commute. By the afternoon, temperatures climbing into the 30s will limit snow accumulation efficiency in the valleys, but travel across Lookout Pass may continue to be impacted by snow through Friday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
